title: Three survivors of Tulsa Riot - support claim

content.question: The author’s reflection that “black Tulsa was destroyed by fire—that is its buildings and property; but its spirit was neither killed nor daunted” serves as evidence of which of the following claims?

choices.label: The resilience of the African American community stayed strong despite the devastation inflicted by the Tulsa Race Massacre.
The Tulsa Race Massacre completely devastated the African American community in Tulsa, leaving no hope for recovery.
There was a lack of support and solidarity from neighboring communities during the Tulsa Race Massacre.
The African American community would easily recover from the devastation of the Tulsa Race Massacre.

content.answer: The resilience of the African American community stayed strong despite the devastation inflicted by the Tulsa Race Massacre.
